name: Sagemaker

metadata.description:
Sagemaker Sensor

SageMaker endpoint invoker.
Used to invoke a SageMaker endpoint run on the AWS platform.

States
  • Not Predicted: Indicates that no results are ready be due to an error.
  • Predicted: Indicates that a request was made and the results are ready to use.

Raw data
  • data: This will contain the result returned by the SageMaker endpoint.

Properties
  • endpoint: The name to the SageMaker endpoint, not the complete url.
  • observations: The object with observations formated in the way that SageMaker endpoint expects.
  • contentType: The MIME type of the observations.
  • SAGEMAKER_CONFIG: The config to use for authenticating with Sagemaker. This is best put in Hoard and referenced here using declerative binding. This object should look like this: 
    {
            "region": The region in which the SageMaker endpoints operate,
            "role": IAM role that has permission to use SageMaker (the user specified with the key-secret pair should be included in this role's trusted entities https://docs.aws.amazon.com/glue/latest/dg/create-an-iam-role-sagemaker-notebook.html),
            "key": They key for the AWS account,
            "secret": The secret for the AWS account
        }
